page.title: 05PORTPATRICKRADIO-PORTPATRICK
page.content: This{British Telecom Coastal {Radio Station,}situated on the cliffs to the north of the village,is part of a{chain of 10 stations around the U.K. keeping a{24 hour distress watch}for{ {ships at sea,}up to{300 miles}from the {coast.The 9 Radio Officers}who man the station also provide{radiotelephone} and{radiotelegraph}services to ships, linking the{international telephone {system}to{marine radio}and handling { {approximately 25,000 telephone calls} and{5,000 telegrams}annually. {Gale warnings,weather forecasts} and{navigational warnings}are also broadcast,using{morse code,voice}and{ {radiotelex. { Portpatrickradio}received the first{S.O.S. of World War Two,}when the liner{S.S.Athenia was torpedoed {off N.W. Ireland. }
